item.title: SWEC Bulletin Generator
item.description: At the start of 2018 I wrote a Python script called swec-elvanto-automation. It was a set of task runners that would manage the automatic generation of the service bulletin, as well as pretty roster emails … well, I’m officially marking it as abandonware! It worked flawlessly, but it wasn’t user friendly. And also, with my other commitments taking more time, I don’t want my involvement and role at my church to become >>>>irreplaceable<<<<.

item.title: Secret Agent
item.description: What is UNSW CSE CompClub? I got the opportunity to take part in my uni computer society’s highschool program (again)! Last time (Winter 2018) I volunteered as a mentor - those people who would help guide the students. This time around I helped out as an organiser, in particular a content writer. That means that I get a whole day to do whatever the heck I want! Yeeeeet!

item.title: City Hunter
item.description: Uni holidays. Preoccupied myself with watching some Korean Drama. My friend recommended me some series called City Hunter. And… it… was… alright actually! I even watched some bits at 1x speed! Spoiler Time Some Koreans go and do a secret mission in North Korea. They complete their objective, but their gov chucks a sneaky and abandons them. One survives, then steals the newborn of a fallen comrade’s wife and raises him up.

item.title: Neutrik EtherCON Kits
item.description: The PreSonus StudioLive 16 and StudioLive 24R have an EtherCON port for their AVB connection. You could forego the EtherCON connector and just connect an Ethernet cable, but I’ve had one occassion where a network stagebox got disconnected because the cable got kicked off. Neutrik sells several EtherCON kits, the two I bought were Neutrik NE8MC and the Neutrik NE8MC-1. (Didn’t need the CAT6 series, which would’ve been the NE8MX6 series)

item.title: Behringer X-Touch Mini
item.description: Got my hands on a Behringer X-Touch Mini USB MIDI Controller (Yay for Facebook Marketplace). Will be using this in my Lightroom editing workflow! Configuration Changing the MIDI Mapping The X-Touch Mini has 12 white buttons. With two layers, that would give us 24 different buttons. However some of the buttons were mapped to the same MIDI control key aka - some buttons are duplicate. So firstly, we’ll need to remap the surface.

item.title: JavaScript Map
item.description: Don’t be lazy kids. Don’t [].map(parseInt) Do [].map(function(val) { parseInt(val) }) Also do [].map((val) => parseInt(val))

item.title: z-index
item.description: Soooo, you can’t interact with an element that has a negative z-index. <div>A</div> --> z-index of 5 <div>B</div> --> z-index of -1 Even if A has pointer-events: none; you won’t be able to touch B <div>A</div> --> z-index of 5 <div>B</div> --> z-index of 0 Can touch B

item.title: Python Tornado vs Flask
item.description: Python has two great web server libraries - Flask and Tornado. Flask vs Tornado Why Flask Flask has a much easier to use routing functionality, where you just need a Python decorator @app.get(...). In Tornado you need to set up a site router, and all these other things (or I didn’t do it right) Why Tornado Tornado is a non-blocking server, which is able to handle multiple requests at the same time.

item.title: HTML Script Tags
item.description: Source - growingwiththeweb.com Summary <script> Block, load, run <script async> Load, run <script defer> Load, wait, run

item.title: Portforwarding with Shootback
item.description: WITHOUT SHADOWSOCKS ./master.py -m 0.0.0.0:58370 -c 0.0.0.0:8380 ./slaver.py -m direct.navhaxs.au.eu.org:58370 WITH SHADOWSOCKS ./master.py -m 127.0.0.1:58370 -c 0.0.0.0:8380` ss-tunnel -c /etc/shadowsocks/config.json -s direct.navhaxs.au.eu.org -l 58370 -L localhost:58370 -u ./slaver.py -m localhost:58370 -t localhost:8001 :: config.json { "server_port": 58388, "password": "", "method": "aes-128-cfb", } // I mean we could’ve always just used reverse ssh port forwarding

item.title: Portforwarding with SSH
item.description: $> ssh [SERVER] -L srcAddr:srcPort:dstAddr:dstPort listens on srcAddr:srcPort which results in [SERVER] connecting to dstAddr:dstPort > Useful for connecting to a device in a network $> ssh [SERVER] -L srcPort:dstAddr:dstPort [SERVER] listens on srcPort which is connecting to connecting to dstAddr:dstPort -R?

item.title: [SCAM] Masters iPhone
item.description: EDIT: Well their Facebook page is down now, hurrah! You know the saying: “If it’s too good to be true, it probably is”. So my friend wanted to upgrade from their iPhone to a Galaxy S9+. Personally, I don’t really care much about getting brand new goods (exceptions exist), so off to the races! Hopped on eBay, Gumtree and Facebook Marketplace to check for some sweet deals. I found a few classifieds from a store called Masters iPhone - supposedly located in Western Australia.

item.title: Whoops There Goes My AI
item.description: GitHub: featherbear/Whoops-There-Goes-My-AI So there’s a game on the Google Play Store and Apple App Store called Whoops! There Goes My Orange. You play as an orange falling from the sky, and you have to avoid the red bars. Simple, right? Yep! But rage-inducing. Anyway, so I decided to have a crack at writing some sort of AI for this game… It’d just be a collision avoidance algorithm… not really an AI.

item.title: RICE Rally 2018 Sydney
item.description: In a world full of noise, how do we find what we’re really looking for? RICE Movement is a Christian organisation that brings the message of Jesus to high schoolers (of Australia, and now New Zealand too!) RICE Rally is their annual event, a big evangelical ‘rally’. I got the opportunity to serve with my brother in the Production team (that is, lyrics and projection). Our playground was three LED walls and two confidence monitors.

item.title: NewTek NDI
item.description: NewTek NDI is a really amazing actually suite of software designed to transport audio and video data over networks. Note: I recommend a gigabit connection between the producers and consumersss, as it easily saturates 100 MB/s with all settings max’d. I’ve been using it a while: Screen recording Laptop screen streaming - Scan Converter on the laptop, Virtual Input on the desktop RICE Rally 2018 - Use OBS to create composites from several NDI sources Software Scan Converter Share your computer screen, or a region of the screen

item.title: ProPresenter 6 Stage Display Messages
School of Codecraft and Hackery
item.description: Workshop Website Day One - Introduction to Python Day Two - Microbits Microbit by BBC is a small piece of hardware with all sorts of sensors and outputs. The uni purchased 20 of these! Unfortunately, the accelerometer module isn’t the best, and alot of the students couldn’t get one of the workshop instructions working. The first activity was to build a firefly, using the wireless radios on the Microbit.
